content.description:
Same start as Marge but instead of climbing the crack step right and climb the bolted slab. Small holds make for some enjoyable techy moves that require good footwork. Bolts are somewhat spaced apart making it a wee bit spicey. 

Same start as Marge.
Standard rack. Bolted achor. Rap the route with a 70 meter rope.

climbs.name: Finger Eleven
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Francois Cote, June 2020

content.description:
Start just right of a large Yellow Birch on the right hand side of large flake. Climb up the flake to gain a ledge and diagonal finger crack. Climb the crack exiting slightly right of Stone Temple Pilots. Very nice ring locks in the middle crack system. 

Just before Simpson Wall there is a slab on the right with a large Yellow Birch tree at the base. Finger Eleven is starts just right of the birch. 
Standard rack. Tree anchor.

Easily the best pitch on the wall and one of the nicest pitches at Cochrane Lane. Great gear abounds on this gem with nice movement on high quality stone. Most of the gear is small so probably double up on small cams. Offset nuts also work very well. 

Located almost directly in front of the Simpson Wall sign. Look for a crack system just left of a big stump. 
Standard rack to 1" piece. Double up on finger size and smaller cams. Tree anchor with chain rap station. Rap the route with a 70 meter rope.

climbs.name: I Wouldn't Rather be Anywhere Else

content.description:
At the right end of Simpson, climb up to a small ledge to clip a bolt. From the bolt make delicate moves up a slab until you reach a stump. Traverse left and merge with Springfield.



Route with one bolt at right side of Simpson

Trad, one bolt

Nice combination of face and crack climbing on good stone. The first 30 feet is kinda run out. Not a lot of gear and it probably wouldn't do much good anyway but the climbing is very easy. After that the gear is awesome. A 60 meter rope will not get you back down to the ground. Use a 70 or you will be looking at doing some downclimbing. 

This is the first route on the left hand side of Simpson Wall. Locate the Simpson Wall sign then look up and left. It is the predominant line that is left of the 3 bolts high on the face. 
Standard rack to 3" piece. Bolted anchor. Rap the route on a 70 meter rope!

Start in the crack system just left of the lone bolt at the right end of Simpson. Continue straight up on sustained 5.8 climbing using a variety of crack technique until you merge with the end of Comrades and Destiny (see Lower Dawn Wall). This route is currently dirty, yet still very enjoyable.



Start in the crack system left of the lone bolt at the right end of Simpson 

Trad, tree anchor

climbs.name: Stone Temple Pilots
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Francois Cote, June 2020

content.description:
Start on a beauty hand crack that leads to a ledge. From here you have two options. Climb either just the off width crack (5.8) or the nice cracks and features left and right. Climb the feature to the top of the block. Tree anchor. This and Finger Eleven are nice, easy, well protected trad climbs that would be great first leads for a new trad climber.

Just before you get to Simpson Wall there is a short slab on the left with a large Yellow Birch tree at the base. 
Standard rack. Tree anchor. Rap the route or walk off.
This is easy to get to, get lots of sun and has good rock. Most of the routes on this wall are about 35 meters in length so a 70 meter rope is essential to get back down to the ground.
